SEARCH
Package GameEngine

Class GameMapGenerator

java.lang.Object
GameEngine.GameMapGenerator
public class GameMapGenerator extends Object
GameMapGenerator generates and manages the complete game map structure, including rooms, connections between rooms, and item placement. Implements a depth-first search based maze generation algorithm with optional braiding to create cycles, ensuring varied and interconnected gameplay maps. Supports automatic placement of levers, questions, pickaxes, and ender pearls, as well as manual room and connection manipulation for map editing.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameMapGenerator

      public GameMapGenerator(int width, int height)
      Constructor for GameMapGenerator. Generates a new map by default.
      Parameters:
      width - the width of the map grid
      height - the height of the map grid

    • GameMapGenerator

      public GameMapGenerator(int width, int height, boolean generate)
      Creates a new GameMapGenerator with the specified dimensions. If generate is true, automatically generates the maze structure, item placements, and levers. If false, creates an empty map ready for manual configuration or loading from a file.
      Parameters:
      width - the width of the map grid
      height - the height of the map grid
      generate - true to automatically generate map content, false to create empty map

  • Method Details

    • generateMap

      public void generateMap()
      Generates the complete map structure including rooms, maze layout, and connections. Uses depth-first search starting from the center to create a spanning tree (perfect maze), then opens the center area for easier navigation, and finally adds cycles (braiding) to create multiple solution paths. The process ensures all rooms are connected while maintaining maze characteristics.

    • getRoom

      public Room getRoom(int x, int y)
      Retrieves the room at the specified grid coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate (column)
      y - the y-coordinate (row)
      Returns:
      the room at the specified coordinates, or null if coordinates are out of bounds

    • getEntrances

      public ArrayUnorderedList<Room> getEntrances()
      Retrieves all entrance rooms (located at the four corners of the map).
      Returns:
      a list containing the four entrance room corners

    • getGraph

      public GameGraph getGraph()
      Retrieves the underlying game graph containing all rooms and connections.
      Returns:
      the GameGraph representing the map structure

    • setRoom

      public void setRoom(int x, int y, Room room)
      Sets the room at the specified grid coordinates and adds it to the graph. Used when loading maps from files to reconstruct the map structure.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate (column)
      y - the y-coordinate (row)
      room - the room to place at these coordinates

    • addConnection

      public void addConnection(int fromX, int fromY, int toX, int toY, boolean isLocked)
      Adds a directional connection between two rooms specified by coordinates. Used when loading maps from files to reconstruct the path network.
      Parameters:
      fromX - the x-coordinate of the starting room
      fromY - the y-coordinate of the starting room
      toX - the x-coordinate of the destination room
      toY - the y-coordinate of the destination room
      isLocked - true if the connection should start locked, false if open

    • breakWall

      public void breakWall(Room room, String direction)
      Creates a new connection (breaks a wall) between two adjacent rooms in the specified direction. Used in map editors to allow manual maze modification.
      Parameters:
      room - the room to create the connection from
      direction - the direction to create the connection ("UP", "DOWN", "LEFT", "RIGHT")

    • getWidth

      public int getWidth()
      Retrieves the width of the map grid.
      Returns:
      the number of columns in the map

    • getHeight

      public int getHeight()
      Retrieves the height of the map grid.
      Returns:
      the number of rows in the map

    • getMapName

      public String getMapName()
      Retrieves the name of the map.
      Returns:
      the map name identifier

    • setMapName

      public void setMapName(String mapName)
      Sets the name of the map.
      Parameters:
      mapName - the new name to assign to this map

    • getPickaxeRooms

      public ArrayUnorderedList<Room> getPickaxeRooms()
      Retrieves all rooms containing pickaxes.
      Returns:
      a list of rooms that have pickaxes available

    • getDistancesTo

      public int[][] getDistancesTo(Room target)
      Calculates the shortest distances from all rooms to a target room using the breadth-first search (BFS) algorithm. Only traverses unlocked connections, making it useful for pathfinding when some doors are locked. Returns a 2D array where each element represents the distance to that room, or Integer.MAX_VALUE if unreachable.
      Parameters:
      target - the target room to calculate distances from
      Returns:
      a 2D array where dist[x][y] is the shortest distance to room at (x,y), or Integer.MAX_VALUE if the room is unreachable from target

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
